channel.title: Metasequoia all you got? Theres more! (Free Modeling Software List)
channel.description:
Many people comment on other peoples models and say 'These arent very good', and most of the time they will reply saying that their software is bad. Well here's a little news flash.. There's others out there to :eek:
[b][u]3D Modeling Software list[/u][/b]
Blender - http://www.blender3d.org/ -[i]Used for game developing, a professional modeling and rendering engine meant for animation and simulation. http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,364010.0.html - a basic guide to blender written by Dylan.[/i] [b]Preview:[/b] [img]http://www.zbrushcentral.com/zbc/attachment.php?attachmentid=30756[/img] [hr]
gmax - http://www.skan.ru/en/software/n939_gmax.html - [i]Ever played GunZ? This is what is used to create private server maps.[/i] [b]Preview:[/b] [img]http://www.daimanpacifica.ro/images/gmax.JPG[/img] [hr]
Now3D - http://digilander.libero.it/giulios/Eng/homepage.htm [b]Preview:[/b] [img]http://digilander.libero.it/giulios/Images/WReflect_29_03b.jpg[/img] [hr]
OpenFX - http://www.openfx.org [b]Preview:[/b] [img]http://www.softpedia.com/screenshots/OpenFX_2.png[/img] [hr]
Terragen - http://www.planetside.co.uk/terragen/download.shtml - [i]Great for terrain![/i] [b]Preview:[/b] [img]http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1101/528368338_650cdb93f0.jpg?v=0[/img] [hr]
Toxic - http://www.toxicengine.org/ - [i]Want your model to be presentable and not some meta screenshot? Use this for rendering with photo realistic quality.[/i] [b]Preview:[/b] [img]http://img212.imageshack.us/img212/2425/sponza2zl2.png[/img] [hr]
Wings 3D - http://www.wings3d.com/ - [i]I used this at first and it is very easy to use and is quite enjoyable, although it lacks rendering and animation. It is still a great download.[/i] [img]http://www.wings3d.com/gallery/soldier.jpg[/img] [hr]
If some of these arent freeware please tell me, i didn't download them all my self.
[b]How do i get the model into my client with this new software?[/b] [i]The same way you would normally. In the new software just look for an object to export, and export it as wavefront (.obj) to your desktop then open it in meta and continue normally.[/i]

item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

SilentCJ:

Export to obj, then import in metasequoia and save as mqo then convert.

Actually, export to .3ds and open the .3ds in Meta. That way you can keep all the materials.

item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Has anyone ever considered Sketchup by Google? I’ve been browsing through the models on their gallery and it looks pretty powerful, more powerful than meta likely. I’m gonna learn how to use it soon, but the only problem is that if you use the free version, you gotta find a plugin to convert to .obj before making it rsps compatible since it only exports as .dae.
